com.tiberiuslabs.BattleChess.GameState

Class GameStateInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiberiuslabs.BattleChess.GameState.GameStateInterface

  • public class GameStateInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Interfaces with the player to make changes to the game state
    • makes and verifies moves/recruitment
    • gets moves from AI if the player is not in 'hot seat' mode
    Author:
    Amandeep Gill

    • Constructor Summary

      GameStateInterface(Color playerColor, AIDifficulty difficulty)
      Initialize the Game with the player's color and the difficulty setting for the AI

      Test to see if the player's move is allowed

      • GameStateInterface

        public GameStateInterface(Color playerColor,
                  AIDifficulty difficulty)
        Initialize the Game with the player's color and the difficulty setting for the AI
        Parameters:
        playerColor - the color of the human player
        difficulty - the difficulty setting for the AI

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game state and gets the AI move if it is the AI's turn

      • testMove

        public boolean testMove(Unit unit,
               Position startPos,
               Position finalPos)
        Test to see if the player's move is allowed
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit that the player wants to move or recruit
        startPos - the start position of the unit (use null if recruiting)
        finalPos - the final position of the unit
        Returns:
        true if the move/recruitment is valid, false otherwise

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(Unit unit,
               Position startPos,
               Position finalPos)
        Attempt to make the move/recruitment that the player is requesting
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit that the player wants to move or recruit
        startPos - the start position of the unit (use null if recruiting)
        finalPos - the final position of the unit
        Returns:
        true if the move/recruitment was successful, false otherwise
